sen.j: 谷 万太郎（たに まんたろう、1835年(天保6年) - 1886年(明治19年)6月30日）は、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Mantaro TANI (1835 - 1886) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 新選組→the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate)としました。
sen.e: Mantaro TANI (1835 - 1886) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 文末の ） を追加しました。
sen.e: Mantaro TANI (1835 - June 30, 1886) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 幼名は万吉。
sen.e: His childhood name was Mankichi.
His childhood name was Mankichi.
His childhood name was Mankichi.

sen.j: 兄は谷三十郎、弟に谷周平。
sen.e: Sanjuro TANI was his older brother and Shuhei TANI was his younger brother.
Sanjuro TANI was his older brother and Shuhei TANI was his younger brother.
Sanjuro TANI was his older brother and Shuhei TANI was his younger brother.

sen.j: 備中松山藩士（旗奉行、120石・役料20石）・谷三治郎供行の二男として備中松山に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Matsuyama, Bicchu Province, as the second son of Sanjiro-Tomoyuki TANI (谷三治郎供行), who was a feudal retainer of Matsuyama Domain of Bicchu Province (Hatabugyo [flag magistrate], with a stipend of 120-koku crop yield and a yakuryo [executive allowance] of 20-koku).
sen.cmt: 谷三治郎供行→正式な読み方が不明です：Sanjiro-Tomoyuki TANI (谷三治郎供行) としました。
sen.e: He was born in Matsuyama, Bicchu Province, as the second son of Sanjiro-Tomoyuki TANI, who was a feudal retainer of Matsuyama Domain of Bicchu Province (Hatabugyo [flag magistrate], with a stipend of 120-koku crop yield and a yakuryo [executive allowance] of 20-koku).
sen.cmt: (谷三治郎供行)を削除しまさひた。[の次のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He was born in Matsuyama, Bicchu Province, as the second son of Sanjiro-Tomoyuki TANI, who was a feudal retainer of Matsuyama Domain of Bicchu Province (Hatabugyo [flag magistrate], with a stipend of 120-koku crop yield and a yakuryo [executive allowance] of 20-koku).

sen.j: 幼少期より父三治郎から武術を学ぶ。
sen.e: He started learning martial arts from his father, Sanjiro (三治郎), since his infancy.
He started learning martial arts from his father, Sanjiro, since his infancy.
He started learning martial arts from his father, Sanjiro, since his infancy.

sen.j: 安政3年（1856年）10月頃、不祥事案により谷家は断絶となる。
sen.e: Around November 1856 (表記の変更), the Tani family 断絶extinguished due to a certain scandal.
Around November 1856, the Tani family extinguished due to a certain scandal.
sen.cmt: (表記の変更)を削除しました。”断絶”を削除しました。
sen.e: Around October 1856, the Tani family extinguished due to a certain scandal.

sen.j: 断絶後は、兄三十郎と共に故郷を出奔する。
sen.e: After the family name was forfeited, he left his home town with his older brother, Sanjuro.
After the family name was forfeited, he left his home town with his older brother, Sanjuro.
After the family name was forfeited, he left his home town with his older brother, Sanjuro.

sen.j: 公卿中山家の侍医・岩田肥後之丞文碩の食客となり、その娘スエを娶り、大坂南堀江町にて道場を開く。
sen.e: He became a guest freeloader of Higonojo-Fumihiro IWATA (岩田肥後之丞文碩), who was the jii (a doctor for the Emperor and the Imperial family) for the Nakayama family, a family of high court noble, and later he took his daughter Sue to wife and opened a dojo (training hall for martial arts) in Horie-cho, Osakaminami.
sen.cmt: 岩田肥後之丞文碩→正式な読み方が不明です：Higonojo-Fumihiro IWATA (岩田肥後之丞文碩)としました。
sen.e: He became a guest freeloader of Higonojo-Fumihiro IWATA, who was the jii (a doctor for the Emperor and the Imperial family) for the Nakayama family, a family of high court noble, and later he took his daughter Sue to wife and opened a dojo (training hall for martial arts) in Horie-cho, Osakaminami.
sen.cmt: (岩田肥後之丞文碩)を削除しました。
sen.e: He became a guest freeloader of Higonojo-Fumihiro IWATA, who was the jii (a doctor for the Emperor and the Imperial family) for the Nakayama family, a family of high court noble, and later he took his daughter Sue to wife and opened a dojo (training hall for martial arts) in Horie-cho, Osakaminami.

sen.j: 1863年頃、新選組に加盟する。
sen.e: Around 1863, he joined the Shinsengumi.
Around 1863, he joined the Shinsengumi.
Around 1863, he joined the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 池田屋事件では土方隊に属し、報奨金20両を賜る。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident, he belonged to Hijikata-tai (the squad lead by Toshizo HIJIKATA) and received a financial incentive of 20-ryo (old currency unit).
sen.cmt: 土方隊→定訳不明：Hijikata-tai (the squad lead by Toshizo HIJIKATA) としました。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident, he belonged to Hijikata-tai (the squad lead by Toshizo HIJIKATA) and received a financial incentive of 20-ryo (old currency unit).
In the Ikedaya Incident, he belonged to Hijikata-tai (the squad lead by Toshizo HIJIKATA) and received a financial incentive of 20-ryo (old currency unit).

sen.j: 同年12月の編成では二番組に属する。
sen.e: After the organizational shuffle in January 1965 (表記の変更), he was assigned to Nibangumi-tai (the second squad).
After the organizational shuffle in January 1965, he was assigned to Nibangumi-tai (the second squad).
sen.cmt: (表記の変更)を削除しました。
sen.e: After the organizational shuffle in January 1965, he was assigned to Nibangumi-tai (the second squad).

sen.j: 大坂でのぜんざい屋事件では、兄三十郎や阿部十郎らとともに大利鼎吉を討った。
sen.e: In the Zenzaiya Incident in Osaka, he killed Teikichi ORI, in cooperation with his older brother Sanjuro, Juro ABE and others.
In the Zenzaiya Incident in Osaka, he killed Teikichi ORI, in cooperation with his older brother Sanjuro, Juro ABE and others.
In the Zenzaiya Incident in Osaka, he killed Teikichi ORI, in cooperation with his older brother Sanjuro, Juro ABE and others.

sen.j: 大坂にあって屯所隊長を務めたが、主に別行動をとることが多く、在籍は確認されるものの、兄三十郎の死後に離脱したものと思われる。
sen.e: While he was in Osaka, he held the position of the leader of quarters, however, as he often acted individually, it seems that he left the Shinsengumi after the death of his brother Sanjuro, although his enrolment until that period is confirmed.
sen.cmt: 屯所隊長→定訳不明：leader of quartersとしました。
sen.e: While he was in Osaka, he held the position of the leader of quarters, however, as he often acted individually, it seems that he left the Shinsengumi after the death of his brother Sanjuro, although his enrolment until that period is confirmed.

While he was in Osaka, he held the position of the leader of quarters, however, as he often acted individually, it seems that he left the Shinsengumi after the death of his brother Sanjuro, although his enrolment until that period is confirmed.

sen.j: 維新後も大坂で道場を経営した。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he continued running the dojo in Osaka.
After the Meiji Restoration, he continued running the dojo in Osaka.
After the Meiji Restoration, he continued running the dojo in Osaka.

sen.j: 西南戦争では、大阪府知事渡辺昇の推薦で一時は抜刀隊の長に擬せられた。
sen.e: During the Seinan War, he acted for a while as the provisional head of Batto-tai (suicide squad, literally called drawn sword squad) recommended by Governor of Osaka Prefecture, Noboru WATANABE.
During the Seinan War, he acted for a while as the provisional head of Batto-tai (suicide squad, literally called drawn sword squad) recommended by Governor of Osaka Prefecture, Noboru WATANABE.
During the Seinan War, he acted for a while as the provisional head of Batto-tai (suicide squad, literally called drawn sword squad) recommended by Governor of Osaka Prefecture, Noboru WATANABE.

sen.j: のちに道場経営に失敗し、商家の用心棒をしながら余生を過ごした。
sen.e: Afterwards, he failed running the dojo, and he spent the rest of his life as Yojinbo (the bodyguard) of a merchant family
Afterwards, he failed running the dojo, and he spent the rest of his life as Yojinbo (the bodyguard) of a merchant family
Afterwards, he failed running the dojo, and he spent the rest of his life as Yojinbo (the bodyguard) of a merchant family

sen.j: のち、妻スエと離婚して愛人吉村たみと同棲。
sen.e: Later, he divorced his wife Sue and lived together without getting married with his lover, Tami YOSHIMURA.
Later, he divorced his wife Sue and lived together without getting married with his lover, Tami YOSHIMURA.
Later, he divorced his wife Sue and lived together without getting married with his lover, Tami YOSHIMURA.

sen.j: 明治19年（1886年）、食道ガンのため大阪にて死去。
sen.e: In 1886, he died of esophageal cancer in Osaka.
In 1886, he died of esophageal cancer in Osaka.
In 1886, he died of esophageal cancer in Osaka.

sen.j: 享年51。
sen.e: He was aged 51.
He was 51.
He was 51.

sen.j: 墓所は、大阪市北区の本伝寺。
sen.e: His grave was located at Honden-ji Temple in Kita Ward, Osaka City.
His grave s located at Honden-ji Temple in Kita Ward, Osaka City.
His grave s located at Honden-ji Temple in Kita Ward, Osaka City.

tit.cmt: 上から7行目の列にも同様表記があり、重複しているようです。

sen.j: 道場の弟子に阿部十郎がいる。
sen.e: Juro ABE was his discipline when he was running the dojo.
Juro ABE was his discipline when he was running the dojo.
Juro ABE was his discipline when he was running the dojo.

sen.j: 明治後、篠原泰之進と交流を持っている。
sen.e: After the Meiji Period, he was associated with Yasunoshin SHINOHARA.
After the Meiji Period, he was associated with Yasunoshin SHINOHARA.
After the Meiji Period, he was associated with Yasunoshin SHINOHARA.

sen.j: 武術として種田流槍術、直心流剣術を使った。
sen.e: He was a skilled hand of the sojutsu (spearmanship) of Taneda-ryu school and the 直心流剣術kenjutsu (swordplay) of Chokushin-ryu.
He was a skilled hand of the sojutsu (spearmanship) of Taneda-ryu school and the kenjutsu (swordplay) of Chokushin-ryu.
sen.cmt: ”直心流剣術”を削除しました。
sen.e: He was a skilled hand of the sojutsu (spearmanship) of Taneda-ryu school and the kenjutsu (swordplay) of Chokushin-ryu.
